source.sqlReaderQuery:
SELECT * FROM
(
	SELECT parameter, value
	FROM config.environment
) AS base
PIVOT
(
	MAX(value) FOR parameter IN (subscription, rg, adf)
) AS pivoted

properties.description: Reaching for multiple records concerning parameters, meaning we have many rows, each for a parameter and it's value. Hard to pick a value. Unreliable.

source.sqlReaderQuery:
SELECT jtp.job, jtp.task, jtp.task_sequence, jtp.parameter, jtp.value
FROM
	config.job_task_parameters jtp
	JOIN
	config.task_parameters tp
	ON
		jtp.task = tp.task
		AND jtp.parameter = tp.parameter
		AND jtp.active = 'Y'
		AND tp.active = 'Y'
		AND tp.parameter_type = 'static'
WHERE jtp.job = 'load_customer'

properties.description: Transposed values. Now very easy to pick a specific parameter's value but on the other hand HARD CODED. New pipeline = modification to hardcode. New parameter = modification to hardcode. Etc...

source.sqlReaderQuery:
SELECT * FROM (
SELECT jtp.job, jtp.task, jtp.task_sequence, jtp.parameter, jtp.value
FROM
	config.job_task_parameters jtp
	JOIN
	config.task_parameters tp
	ON
		jtp.task = tp.task
		AND jtp.parameter = tp.parameter
		AND jtp.active = 'Y'
		AND tp.active = 'Y'
		AND tp.parameter_type = 'static'
WHERE jtp.job = 'load_customer'
	AND jtp.task = 'PL_extract_from_sqldb'
) AS n
PIVOT
(
	MAX(value) FOR parameter IN (src_sql, tgt_folder, tgt_filename)
) AS p

properties.description:
Now a dynamic Stored Procedures picks proper params per job and task in a good format.
Also simple logging is being added. Note that job_id and task_id are the same for now - that is because job_id should be a parent pipeline id which ochestrates several tasks as a one job.
A control table updates are added. These are more than logging. They store job info between task runs so the tasks can pick it from there. Also statuses.

Incremental load using watermark table.
Again job name was hardcoded because at the moment of creation there is no parent orchestrator pipeline.

source.sqlReaderQuery:
SELECT * FROM
(
	SELECT parameter, value
	FROM config.environment
) AS base
PIVOT
(
	MAX(value) FOR parameter IN (subscription, rg, adf)
) AS pivoted
